name: Giyeok
description: A plain stop sound produced at the back of the tongue.

name: Nieun
description: A nasal sound produced near the gum ridge.

name: Digeut
description: A plain stop sound produced near the gum ridge.

name: Rieul
description: A liquid sound where the tongue tip taps or flows near the gum ridge.

name: Mieum
description: A nasal sound produced by the lips.

name: Bieup
description: A plain stop sound produced by closing and releasing the lips.

name: Siot
description: A fricative sound produced near the gum ridge.

name: Ieung
description: Silent at the start of a syllable, but acts as a nasal [ng] sound at the end (batchim).

name: Jieut
description: A plain affricate sound produced by blocking and releasing with friction.

name: Kieuk
description: A strong (aspirated) stop sound from the back of the tongue.

name: Tieut
description: A strong (aspirated) stop sound near the gum ridge.

name: Pieup
description: A strong (aspirated) stop sound from the lips.

name: Hieut
description: A fricative sound produced in the throat.

name: Ssanggiyeok
description: A tense sound produced by doubling the 'ㄱ' sound.

name: Ssangdigeut
description: A tense sound produced by doubling the 'ㄷ' sound.

name: Ssangbieup
description: A tense sound produced by doubling the 'ㅂ' sound.

name: Ssangsiot
description: A tense fricative sound produced by doubling the 'ㅅ' sound.

name: Ssangjieut
description: A tense affricate sound produced by doubling the 'ㅈ' sound.
